Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2008 10:52PM Dorothy_2008 wrote: Well I finally got my report today. Not too sure about the results other than my General Surgeon wants me to see an Oncologist. I did ask him for a copy of the report and he wants to see me in 6 weeks after going to the Oncologist. Just from reading this board I "Think" I may have what you refer to as LCIS. There was also mentioned in the report of "atypical lobular hyperplasia". The report reads like GREEK to me. Any input greatly appreciated. I can't believe I had to wait 2 weeks for this report!!!!
Posts.Title: ALSO Waiting for Test Results Dorothy_2008 Dorothy_2008

Posts.Content: Nov 25, 2008 10:04PM Dorothy_2008 wrote: Please don't think I'm being rude but why are women going to general surgeons for breast biopsies?  I have Tri-Care Prime insurance (we call it TRY TO get CARE!!!) and have to do as told by them, I don't have a choice and can't afford to go where my insurance isn't approved. shap wrote: Hi...I went through just the same thing last week. I have my post surgical doctor's appt tomorrow. I hope you have good results. I don't go back for my post-op till Dec 3rd and the waiting is killing me......

Diabetes and Breast Cancer kmccraw423 kmccraw423

Posts.Content: Mar 4, 2009 06:41PM Dorothy_2008 wrote: I have type 2 Diabetes also, but due to NOT eating right (2003 - end of June 2008) I now have Stage 3 Chronic Kidney Disease too. So be sure to keep on TOP of your Blood Sugar's. I'm scheduled for a PBM March 17th. Right now I'm off the Diabetic meds totally, BUT having a heck of a time regulating my blood sugars. If I have anywheres from 20-25 carbs in a meal my blood sugar may go too high now. The main thing I can suggest is keeping a log/journal of foods you eat with the carbs listed and tesing your blood sugar BEFORE every meal and 1-2 hours from the first bite you eat. I have to track carbs, calories, proteins and sodium. Dorothy
